intro: Pilosella virgata, commonly known as the slender hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to Europe, Asia, and North Africa. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble daisies. The plant typically grows in open, sunny habitats such as grasslands and disturbed soils. Its leaves are narrow and covered in fine hairs, giving it a distinctive appearance. Pilosella virgata produces small, yellowish flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer.
